alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 8:29PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Coffee and north central Geneva Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 828 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elba, moving south at 30 mph. At 815 CDT, the Enterprise Municipal Airport measured a wind gust of 47 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elba, Enterprise, New Brockton, Coffee Springs, Chancellor, Richburg, Carl Folsom A/p, Lucile, Turner Crossroads, Central City, Cool Springs, Battens Crossroads, Goodman, New Haven, Enterprise Municipal A/P, Woodland Grove Church and Marvin Chapel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
